title: Venezuela: How the US spent months preparing the military operation to capture Maduro
subhead: Images verified by Le Monde made it possible to reconstruct the US's vast military deployment at sea, on land and in the air in the months leading up to the abduction of the Venezuelan president.

title: US will control Venezuelan oil sales 'indefinitely,' energy secretary says
Europe yet to give 'clear, unequivocal answer' on Ukraine defense, Zelensky says
'Whoever controls Greenland influences a key area of European security policy'
subhead: In response to US threats to invade the vast Arctic island, the EU must implement close military cooperation with Denmark, supported by Germany and France, argues economist Guntram Wolff.

title: France bans food imports containing pesticides
subhead: The five substances targeted include fungicides, used on produce ranging from avocados to soybeans, and glufosinate, an herbicide widely used on potatoes. The move is aimed at easing farmers' opposition to the Mercosur trade deal.

title: Brigitte Bardot buried in Saint-Tropez as cause of death revealed
subhead: The French actress, who died on December 28, was buried in the town's seaside cemetery. The religious ceremony began at 11 am. Earlier, her husband revealed she had died from cancer.

title: Gaza's grandparents, shattered pillars of a traumatized society
subhead: Elderly people, whose health is often fragile and mobility reduced, feel as if they are reliving the tragedy of the Nakba, the forced exodus of Palestinians during the creation of Israel in 1948.

'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhead: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhead: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

title: Maduro capture marks new blow to dying international order
subhead: Venezuela's allies condemned an 'illegal act of aggression' while countries aligned with the US urged restraint but sought to avoid directly criticizing Donald Trump.

title: EU-Mercosur deal: France's diplomatic gamble falls short
'The US intervention in Venezuela violates foundational principles of contemporary international law'
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
